Description: Wheel-made Greek oil-lamp covered in black slip. No handle. Circular body and a pointed pouring nozzle rounded at the end, with a small circular hole. Small circular hole in the centre, surrounded by an indented rim and incised ring. Small raised circular rimmed base. Fabric not clearly visible, but likely reduced Nile silt fabric.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Nottingham Castle Museum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

See Naukratis H2763, without a lug (Bristol Museum). Probably a local Egyptian copy of early Hellenistic forms (Bailey 1975, Q522-Q524, Q529, Q533; particularly Q525-Q527 with lug). Late 4th or 3rd century BC parallel from Alexandria (Blondé 1998, 313-4, no. 2). Blondé, F. 1998. Lampes tournée Hellénistiques du Musée d’Alexandrie, in Empereur, J-Y. (ed.), Commerce et Artisant dans l’Alexandrie Hellénistique et Romaine, Paris, 307-35.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KC.53) (Phase 3)
